title: Hermès grants 4,000-euro bonus to all employees
description: The generosity stems from exceptional profits in 2022 when sales grew by more than 20% in consecutive quarters, including in the last three months of 2022.

title: Qatar consortium confirms bid for Manchester United
description: Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad Al Thani did not mention what the bid would be but the price is now estimated to reach as high as $6 billion.

title: War in Ukraine: The tragedy of Yahidne, a village trapped in Russia's failed offensive on Kyiv
description: This village of 300 inhabitants was only supposed to be a stop on the way to the capital for the Russian troops. It became their entrenched camp and its inhabitants their human shields. For 28 days, they were imprisoned in the school basement in appalling conditions.

title: French biotech AdipoPharma and its miracle molecule look to conquer America
description: Vincent Marion's start-up will launch clinical trials in the United States for an anti-diabetic drug that is the result of ten years of research.

title: Pakistani Taliban claim attack on police headquarters in Karachi
description: The firearm and grenade attack left two attackers dead and at least one security official wounded.

title: Police bust eight in France and Israel 'fake CEO' scam
description: At this stage of the investigation, €3.9 million has been seized from a scam estimated at €38 million.

title: A Berlinale echoing current global drama
description: The 73rd edition of the festival, which will show several Ukrainian and Iranian films, opened on Thursday, February 16.

title: In Nigeria, 'Team Jorge' hackers collaborated with Cambridge Analytica
description: #StoryKillers. In 2015, the Israeli disinformation operatives worked with the British company to help the incumbent president of Africa's most populous country.

title: Bulgaria: At least 18 migrants found dead in truck near Sofia
description: The Bulgarian interior ministry says vehicle was carrying about 40 people 'hidden under wood.'

title: Five Memphis ex-police officers plead not guilty of Tyre Nichols death
description: The five officers are out on bond. Another hearing is scheduled for May 1.

title: French court convicts three over plot to assassinate Macron
description: Three men part of a far-right group known as the 'Barjols' were convicted for conspiracy to commit a terrorist act on Friday.

title: Macron struggles to find a representative for Islam in France
description: On Thursday, the President of France welcomed the members of the Forum of Islam of France, which will take over from the French Council for Muslim Worship.

title: India accuses BBC of tax evasion after three-day search of offices
description: The searches were criticized by opposition political parties and Reporters Without Borders, who called them 'attempts to clamp down on independent media.'

title: Zelensky presses allies to speed up military support at Munich Conference
description: Russia could still 'destroy many lives,' the Ukrainian leader warned.

title: Ukraine accuses French retailer Auchan of being Russia's 'weapon' after revelations
description: 'Le Monde' and its partners revealed that goods sold by the company were supplying the Russian military in Ukraine.

title: Tom Luddy, éminence grise of New Hollywood, has died
description: Founder of the Telluride Film Festival, in Colorado, the American was Francis Ford Coppola's right-hand man and Jean-Luc Godard's helper. He passed away at the age of 79 on February 13, in California.

title: Eliminalia, a Spanish reputation management firm burying the truth for disreputable clients
description: #StoryKillers. The Spanish reputation management company helps public figures in trouble with the law to remove articles from the internet and to promote content that is favorable to them.

title: Burkina Faso: Where Russians, Wahhabis and pan-Africanists join forces around the junta
description: During the demonstrations in support of the putschists, strict Muslims swelled the ranks of organizations calling for closer cooperation with Moscow and an end to the French presence.

title: In Turkey, Haluk Levent is a rock star with a big heart
description: At record speed, the musician raised nearly €50 million and mobilized volunteers to help the victims of the earthquake, as the government is being criticized for its inaction.

title: British embassy guard jailed for spying for Moscow
description: David Smith, who worked at the UK's Berlin embassy, was sentenced to over 13 years under the Official Secrets Act.

title: French start-up Getfluence and its very discreet 'sponsored articles'
description: #StoryKillers. The French platform, which 'places' advertising articles on news sites, has been used for influence operations.

title: Years of graft and neglect weaken Turkey's Erdogan
description: As early as 2003, the Turkish president promised to clean up the construction sector. Twenty years on, the poor quality of buildings played a major role in the human toll of February 6's earthquake.

title: There are more losers than winners in the French pension reform debate
description: With the left-wing opposition in Parliament turning the issue into political theater, only the trade unions form a unified front against the bill supported by President Emmanuel Macron, writes 'Le Monde' columnist Gilles Paris.

title: War in Ukraine: 'It's unrealistic to think that tank deliveries will change the situation overnight'
description: Military technologies specialist Pierre Grumberg details the complexity – from crew training to armaments, including logistics – of integrating German Leopards, American M1 Abrams or British Challenger 2 tanks into the Ukrainian army.

title: France's EDF posts record annual loss, debt swells
description: The state-controlled utility was required to sell electricity under cost following soaring energy prices due to the war in Ukraine.

title: Spain approves gender self-determination with 'trans equality law'
description: The law allows the gender on identity papers to be changed without any further action other than a public declaration of non-conformity with the gender assigned at birth.

title: Bill Gates and Jonas Gahr Støre: 'No nation alone can solve a global problem by itself'
description: Billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates and Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre explain in an op-ed that the global crises in energy, food and health can be avoided if we act together.

title: How a French company is supporting Russia's war effort in Ukraine
description: Video investigation. Tools, cigarettes and clothes sold by French retailer Auchan supply Russian soldiers on the Ukrainian front, sometimes with the complicity of its Russian subsidiary.

title: Israeli tech sector's 'grey zone' provides agents for spreading disinformation
description: #StoryKillers. Several companies specializing in false information and influence, such as 'Team Jorge' and Percepto, were founded by former intelligence and military personnel.

title: Protests hit multiple Iran cities for first time in weeks
description: Online videos posted on Friday morning showed demonstrations in Iran's capital, Tehran, as well as in the cities of Arak, Isfahan, Izeh and Karaj. The demonstrations, marking 40 days since Iran executed two men on charges related to the protests, show the continuing anger in the country.

title: France is a battleground for pro- and anti-Qatar influence operations
description: #StoryKillers. Qatar has been at the heart of online clashes in France for years. The latest is a complex manipulation operation that 'Le Monde' has discovered is tied to a secretive Israeli disinformation unit.

title: In Paris, BHV Marais department store changes hands
description: The Galeries Lafayette group, owner of the famous Bazar de l'Hôtel de Ville, has entered exclusive negotiations with the SGM group.

title: Kosovo: 15 years after independence, Serbian minority still depends on Belgrade
description: The 40,000 Serbs who live in northern Kosovo on the border with Serbia, continue for the most part to look to Belgrade, on which they depend financially.

title: A third French fighter killed on the Ukrainian battlefield
description: According to information from 'Le Monde', Andreas Gallozzi, a man from Dijon in his twenties, died on Thursday, killed by a Russian strike in eastern Ukraine.

title: French pension reform: union leaders march in Albi
description: For the fifth day of protests, the unions jointly marched in the southern French city known as the stronghold of Jean Jaurès, a historical figure of French socialism.

title: 5 key takeaways from New York Fashion Week
description: Designer Catherine Holstein grabbed everyone's attention with her Kaithe brand and 'fruit' and 'animal' clothes brought a touch of surrealism to the event. This year, American fashion week has shaken up the old rules of traditional sportswear.
